title: Drive mount polling missing directories
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Google drive changes polling doesn't work for new directories, when moving with rclone, only if the parent dir is refreshed with `rclone rc vfs/forget dir=/parent`.
If created on the UI, it works.

Using a rclone crypt mount.
`teamdrive -> crypt`

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
```
rclone --version
rclone v1.41-070-g67e9ef45β
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
`4.16.0-1-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.16.5-1 (2018-04-29) x86_64 GNU/Linux`

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Team drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
`rclone move /data/local/local1/file1 test:/local1`

Mount options:
```
rclone mount \
  --config=/home/data/.rclone.conf \
  --allow-other \
  --rc \
  --fast-list \
  --drive-skip-gdocs \
  --dir-cache-time=168h \
  --poll-interval=60s \
  --max-read-ahead=64M \
  --buffer-size=16M \
  --vfs-read-chunk-size=16M \
  --vfs-read-chunk-size-limit=1G \
  --drive-chunk-size=64M \
  --transfers=6 \
  --timeout=10m \
  --syslog \
  -vv \
  test: /data/cloud
```
